intro: Podalyria alba, commonly known as the white scabious, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a member of the Caprifoliaceae family and typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and rocky habitats. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. Podalyria alba is valued for its ornamental appeal and serves as a host plant for certain butterfly species.
